meanings.definition: The act of dividing something incorrectly or improperly.
meanings.sent1: The misdivision of the cake led to unequal slices for the party guests.
meanings.sent2: The teacher made a misdivision of the candies, giving some students more than others.
meanings.sent3: During the game, there was a misdivision of teams, causing confusion among the players.
meanings.sent4: The misdivision of responsibilities in the group project resulted in chaos.
meanings.sent5: The misdivision of the puzzle pieces made it impossible to complete the picture.

meanings.definition: A mistake or error in the process of dividing something.
meanings.sent1: The misdivision of the money caused a financial discrepancy.
meanings.sent2: She realized her misdivision of time when she missed the deadline.
meanings.sent3: The misdivision of the ingredients in the recipe led to a disastrous cake.
meanings.sent4: His misdivision of attention between work and social life affected his performance.
meanings.sent5: The misdivision of the land among siblings created disputes within the family.
